body.p: To His Excellency B MaGoffin Govr of Ky

Your Petitioner James S Fulton admr Jno Sacra States that at the Octr term 1859 of the Franklin Circuit Court a fine was rendered against Said Sacra for $40 -- for permitting his negro man Peter to hire his own time to other persons
He states that the proof on Said law was that the witness employed Peter to make a Batten door and this was all that was proved
He Said Sacra is dead and his estate is oppressed with debts and his is desirous of closing the estate

James s Fulto^n^
admr J C Sacry

I was attorney for Jno Sacra in the above named cause and my recollection is that Peter did Some Small amount of carpenter work for the witness. I can State that the negro Peter has lived with me and a more peacable and obedient negro I never Saw

Franklin Cir. ct
Petition of J. S. Fulton
admr Jno. C. Sacra
Remitted
B. M.
Issd Jany 2d 1861
